title: Master of Business Administration, Business Strategy
school: Joseph M. Katz Graduate School of Business

title: Expert Software Engineer
description: I work on OpenStack, acting as the unofficial cross-project advocate for all things JavaScript in OpenStack. With so many engineers focused on improving our user interfaces, it falls to me to build and maintain the library and services foundation which supports them. In my day to day work I define technical policy, make tooling choices for the community, write technical specifications, and perform no small amount of mediation work to ensure my colleagues have what they need to be productive.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description: I design, build, and analyze technology platforms on which education can be democratized and community driven. It's not just about the technology, the client applications, or the services implementation - those are all just pieces that fit into a much larger vision: Education needs to be accessible to anyone, everyone, for free, and needs to be as effective as possible. To accomplish this, I mix a variety of disciplines: The design rigor that only comes from being a seasoned software engineer, the business analytics experience from my management background, my strong ethical code from OSS and an academic family, and the creative background from my BArch that allows me to not only design an integrated system, but imagine how it can grow.

title: Senior Flex Engineer
description: I lead a multinational team of chinese and american software engineers in building an administration portal for summer camps.

title: Senior Flex Developer
description: Software engineer on the Flex 3/Flex 4.5 platform, building software applications for clients such as WalMart, HP, Limited Brands, and Home Depot.

title: New Media Developer
description: Full spectrum website development, mostly via PHP, Flash, and Javascript.

title: Consultant
description: I built several healthcare e-learning courses which interface with a SCORM-compliant backend.

title: E-Learning Developer
description: Lead developer of SCORM-compliant e-learning for a pharmacy automation system.

title: eslint-config-openstack
description: Centralized JavaScript language linting configuration for all of OpenStack.

title: Livemocha Culture Wall
description: A new section of livemocha.com, which allowed our community members to share photos and stories from their own cultures.

title: Livemocha Language Games
description: A suite of games to encourage language learning. Vocabulary packs were available via purchased or earned currency, and members were encouraged to interact and play with their friends.

title: Livemocha Spoken Language Engine
description: Maintenance and updates on the core Livemocha experience, a social learning engine which allowed our community to grade each others' exercises, and engage in conversation with each other.

title: Livemocha Pivot
description: Livemocha's pivot sought to build on the engagement of its existing community, to create a custom education platform for international businesses. Two thick-client browser applications permitted the creation, sequencing, and consumption of highly customized language content.

title: Wheel Mirrors For OpenStack Infra
description: A mirror of pre-built wheels for OpenStack's requirements, removing the need for test-time compilation. Devstack gate jobs are now 20 minutes faster, an effective 30% increase in OpenStack's gate capacity.

title: Request Interception in ng-resource
description: Enable request and requestError interception in AngularJS's ng-resource library, permitting pre-request decoration and annotation of RESTful resource requests.

title: Yeoman generator-openstack
description: A project creation and maintenance utility, to ensure consistent project structure across OpenStack's JavaScript projects.

title: OpenStack NPM Publishing
description: OpenStack is now able to publish packages to the Node Package Manager (npm).

title: CORS Support in OpenStack
description: OpenStack now supports Cross Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) as per the W3C Specification.

title: Consolidated Mirrors For OpenStack Infra
description: Replaced all python mirrors in OpenStack's infrastructure with AFS-driven mirrors that can artifacts for multiple languages and systems.
